div.p:
April 3, 2020
Wilber-Clatonia students, parents, families and staff:
I want to take this opportunity to thank you for your patience and flexibility as we work through th is unprecedented time. AS you may have seen already, Governor Richetts announced an additional Directed Health Measure (DHM) Wednesday evening. This announcement came without any "heads up" to school leaders across . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about COVID 19 UPDATE

h3.a: Recommendations for Continued School Closure Due to COVID -19

div.p:
Recommendations for Continued School Closure Due to COVID-19
March 24, 2020
Recommendations for Continued School Closure Due to COVID-19
Based on the current epidemiological risk factors, and projections by state, federal and national health officials, Four Corners Health Department (FCHD), and Public Health Solutions (PHS), strongly recommend that all schools served by ESU 6 close (without . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Recommendations for Continued School Closure Due to COVID -19

div.p:
WILBER-CLATONIA PUBLIC SCHOOLS WILL RECOGNIZE SPRING BREAK FOR ALL STUDENTS AND STAFF ON FRIDAY, APRIL 10 and MONDAY, APRIL 13.
THERE WILL BE NO SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM ON FRIDAY, April 10th OR MONDAY, April 13, but WILL RESUME ON TUESDAY, APRIL 14.
The school will be providing free breakfast and lunch meals to children 1 to 18. If you would like to sign up for this . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about School Meals

div.p:
Elementary Pick Up Schedule
W-C families our teachers and staff have been working diligently in preparing for the next couple of weeks. Secondary activities will be pushed out on Sunday evening. Elementary learning packet activities and 4-12 students that requested a chromebook from the technology office may pick up materials on Friday during the times scheduled below by last name:
A-G - . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Elementary Scheduled Pick up

div.p:
Technology Remote Information
The Wilber-Clatonia Technology Department is continuing to get things into place for our Wilber-Clatonia Students. The teachers and administration have worked together to create educational plans for all WC Students. Our goal as a department is to support those plans.
At this time, students in grades 4-12 who are in need of a Chromebook to be able . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Technology Remote Information
Read more about COVID-19 LETTER

div.p:
3/10/2020
Wilber-Clatonia Parents,
The spread of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19), which started in Wuhan, China has generated world, regional, and local news daily. We want to ensure you that we are monitoring the cases of COVID-19 closely in the news and will continue to stay up to date with any correspondence we receive from multiple state entities including DHHS . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Coronavirus Disease 2019
